Constructor Detail

Tool

public Tool(ItemType shapeType)
Method Detail

activate

public abstract void activate()
Activates the tool for the given view. This method is called whenever the user switches to this tool. Use this method to reinitialize a tool.

deactivate

public abstract void deactivate()
Deactivates the tool. This method is called whenever the user switches to another tool. Use this method to do some clean-up when the tool is switched. Subclasses should always call super.deactivate.

mouseDown

public abstract void mouseDown(int x,
                               int y,
                               java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
Handles mouse down events in the drawing view.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of mouse position.
y - The y-coordinate of mouse position.
e - The mouse event, contains state of modifiers.

Parameters:

e - The mouse event, contains state of modifiers.
